meanings.english_definition: Having a value or cost of twelve shillings.

usage_notes.explanation: This term is historical and relates to the pre-decimal British currency system. A shilling was a unit of currency, and twelve shillings would represent a specific amount of money.

readability_explanation.text: This term is specific to historical British currency and is unlikely to be encountered in modern contexts. Understanding requires knowledge of the pre-decimal British monetary system.
